p:
Racane et al. obtained the furyl and thienyl based diamidino substituted derivatives of phenyl-BTA and screened them for antiproliferative activities against different tumour cell line in vitro. Derivative 25 (diamidino-substituted thiophene based BTA, Figure 15) and 26 (imidazolinyl-substituted thiophene based BTA; Figure 15) exhibited low cytotoxic effects on normal human fibroblasts and strong antiproliferative effects on MiaPaCa-2 and MCF-7 cancer cell lines. The experimental data indicated that the benzothiazole derivatives having thiophene and imidazole substitions possessed interesting antiproliferative activities
35 .
